New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history with 50 home runs and stolen bases in a single season.
Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Dodgers dominated the Miami Marlins, winning 20-4, and clinched a postseason berth.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani needed two more home runs to reach 50 and two more stolen bases to reach 50.
Post-Match Reflections: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred congratulated Ohtani on his remarkable achievement and praised his character, drive, and commitment to excellence.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani's slash line in 2024 is.294/.376/.629, with 176 hits, 120 RBI, and 377 total bases in 153 games.
Others: The Dodgers look to earn their third straight NL West division title with nine games left in the season.
